alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 5:13AM EST until December 21 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Kennebec and Sagadahoc Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at North Sidney. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Portions of Lithgow Street in Winslow floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 24.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EST Tuesday was 24.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 28.4 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
